g5FNQmxhyrtLBgme1vgDLA.text: This was the first pub I hit on my first trip to London. It was one of the more inviting looking places and in a great location right in the heart of Shepherd Market. I naturally had to try the fish and chips, especially since their sign out front talked up a big game when it came to that particular meal. It was a pretty mellow place that night but the food was good and they had a TV with sports on it which made it nice for the solo diner. The service was slightly above average when compared to some of the surrounding pubs, not the best but definitely not the worst. Rather than writing a review on my first British pub on my first night in town, I decided to hit several others first to get some context and I'm glad I did. I probably would have been overly generous had I not done it that way but at the same time, it held its ground against pretty much any of the other pubs I hit so while I cannot rave about it being the greatest place in the world, it also did not disappoint. I would definitely go back again.

WKKW0Qt525vtcSMVAphTbQ.text: Two floors, a good beer selection, decent food, wide screen TVs, and a friendly crowd. A very nice area with lots of small pubs and restaurants. A hidden gem. Nothing really outstanding from other pubs, but I like this one better than Ye Grapes just down the street. Seems a bit classier for some reason.

130nhPES1KDmpWmH7VGcyg.text: Nice little pub tucked away round the corner from Green Park. This place forms one side of a small pub / restaurant oasis away from the busy streets.For drinks we have some good cider choices, a quartet of ales and a selection of middlemarch wine. Three drinks will push past 10£ at current prices.Two tvs with sport though. However not much standing space.

3rH7mF79lT2w_64eKjJF6g.text: A good place to eat something for launch. I really enjoyed jacked potatoes. Soft music a the good English pub atmosphere. Just two steps away from Buckingham Palace.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Jacket Potato: really good!

o6ItleVdadQguBDr7PoTBA.text: Stopped  by for drinks in the early evening, asked what time they served food till and was told 10 PM.  The food they were serving looked good. Bounced around to a few different pubs for drinks then went back at 9:30 for dinner and was told they were out of food. Very disappointing!

lvLM4vzP9N0lavgsF8WlwA.text: Bucket List: London Pub - CheckLast night in London so we wanted to check out a good solid London Pub. Great find!After Dinner and some drinks at Mr. Kong (Best Chinese food ever had), we decided to hit up a pub for some more drinks. Great Idea on clear , crisp night. Kings Arm is located close to the Green Park Underground station (2-3 blocks away). It is down a back ally, which is kinda scary, but it is exactly what you think of when you think of the London Streets, dark, kinda scary, but lined with inviting food and drink places!Kings Arm is a small place, not sure if there is an upstairs, but the Pub is downstairs (ground floor). You def get the warm and cozy feeling when you walk in, everyone was talking, having a good time, even the bartenders. They were nice and courteous, even to two American tourists. They had about 4 beers on draft and several wine selections on top of the full bar. Selection wise Not over the top but decent. The beer, mixed drinks and wine were all good and fresh tasting. The crowd was great too, a whole mix of students, tourists and locals.  We arrived after the kitchen had closed so I cant speak to the food, but the beers, atmosphere and location were killer. I would def. go back in a heart beat. Note: Alot of bars close at 11pm during the week. For Americans that's crazy, but just beware. Dong Dong! Was that Big Ben or Last call... either way another round on me! See you at the bar.

l6JoSfnWj-VgKzGNjB6rzg.text: Good fish & chips.  Friendly staff.  Repeat visitor.  Very trustworthy.  Left my credit card at the bar by accident months ago.  No unauthorized charges.  Anxious  to go back and try bangers and mash.  Peas served with everything.

-_JSMzC7MtHJvG6jhJ3uow.text: Just stopped in for a pint of Greene King IPA. Usually a good dependable ale. Tastes like they don't clean the lines very often or they do but don't flush them through properly. Shame as a very nice cosy pub otherwise. Bye bye.

GrGJhc4YDamozb73IbtPXg.text: Friendly staff, comfortable place to hang out to have a  few brews... Or two or three.

OhyV3vzNeVR5WwsTpOoA_g.text: Down a tiny dark alley from the Sheraton, this pub beckoned to me every night I was in London during my recent trip but I felt I should try to explore more than just one place.  I should have just stuck with my instincts and returned here each evening, for the friendly service as much as the cheery mixed crowd that comes in to enjoy the yummy cold Guinness.Only downside is that it closes at 11.  But I gather that's kind of the norm for places in the area, so I really can't downgrade my rating for that.

14TkULvGzeFU11N77VgWZA.text: Last time I was in London, eleven years ago, I had one of the best burgers of my life at the original Hard Rock.  I wanted to go back and have another, but I picked Friday to do it.  The crowds were too dense for my hunger.  But I followed my First Rule of London Pubs: walk two blocks off of any major tourist thoroughfare, and you'll find a proper one.Kings Arms did not disappoint.  There was a small but friendly crowd waiting to watch the World Cup.  I had a ploughman's lunch and a good local IPA.  The barman was friendly but not intrusive: the sort of bluff, salty chap you expect behind the counter at a solid English pub.Protip: if they still have Sharp's Brewery on tap here when you visit, step up to the bar with a fiver in hand and order a pint of Doom.  You can tell a man who's had a pint of Doom.  There's a distant look in his eyes, like storm clouds off the cliffs of Dover, and he fears not the sting of death.

2BWQTfxIjTv73OscChhNMg.text: I honestly wonder if the people giving this place 4 and 5 star reviews were in London for more than a day. Saying this place is a solid English pub is like visiting a Starbucks and saying you've been to a solid, authentic coffee house or Chipotle and saying you've been to an authentic taqueria. It's a Taylor Walker and if you spend more than an hour in London you'll quickly realize that they're a big chain who seem to have a pub on every corner. The beer selection was fairly modest with Doom being perhaps the most interesting offering on tap (and that's no saying much). The food was pretty uninspired. Really, the decor is the only thing going for this place.

79Yqs96sYZOV4uEyR5Oo7g.text: Great Pub in Mayfair down a little street that opens into a cute little neighborhood of shops, restaurants and pubs.  The main pub is downstairs with a seating area and a large flat screen upstairs.  Everyone from the staff to the patrons was very friendly.  There seemed to be a great mix of people - young and old, a few well dressed professionals, some tourists and on and on.   Didn't really taste the food - had some "not so special" nachos - but the beer and the atmosphere were fantastic.  Highly recommended if you want to get away from the crowds and fast pace of Piccadilly Street!

0o5jlSfufADDCfrqSOqhPA.text: I walked in a couple times with intentions of getting fish 'n chips but I felt really uncomfortable because everyone was just drinking.  Nobody was eating.  Nada.  Nothing.  Not even eating crisps (potato chips to us yanks).This happened on two different evenings.Their sign out front may say "Best Fish N Chips in Town" but from the looks of things my guess is food isn't their specialty.  There was little indication they had a kitchen or even tableware.So I walked out and grabbed some food at another place.

q0mkAzxSOG5RyiHqbqHiIQ.text: It was Sunday night after a long reception at JW, I was desperately looking for a place to eat & drink with my colleagues from overseas. The punchbowl (my 1st choice) was closed, Lion was packed with same reception group, ended up walking down the street and found Kings Arms. The service was very friendly, though the kichen was super slow. Maybe because they were closing kichen in 15 minutes, but could be faster. Our waitress was very friendly and fun to chat with, drink was served very fast. The location is in the Mayfair, not too near or far from all touristy things. Also the area is packed with many food venues who stay open late, so if you were like me, missing the kichen close at Kings, then head over to a pizza place, have a lice, and come back for another round of happy time. I will go back there again for raid back time.

JCBlD37OfEaubni1X5-wBg.text: After wondering around Mayfair for a whole afternoon, I was getting tired and hungry, and couldn't wait to find a cozy pub to sit down for some beer and hot food. My friend and I stopped by a few places in the area, but since it was a Sunday night, the neighborhood was quite, and we being tourists and all, didn't want to intrude.We ended up at Kings Arms because there was a decent crowd in there, mostly locals but I'd say one table of European tourists. Although there were not more seats left on the first floor, we decided to stay in the warm and lively bar area and study the menu. The bar-tenders and the manager (or some kind of owner/supervisor person) were very friendly and welcoming, and the atmosphere was nice.As we finally sat down, we decided to go with the cliche and order a large fish n chips to share and some bread and butter on the side. Maybe I just like food so much that I'd fall for anything, but the huge piece of fried cod had me convinced. It was fresh and juicy, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Although it wasn't my first time in London, Kings Arms definitely felt like a warm neighborhood welcome.

IHJaFFZhl_6HC3loTWxzvg.text: Decent place to eat, very laid back. Reasonable turnout for a Monday night. The location in the Mayfair district is pretty good, and it certainly balances out all the expensive places down the road in Green Park. The food is nothing spectacular, but it's good. Beer selection is alright, with a few real ales on tap and some pub staples (Fosters, etc.). Nothing here is amazing, it's just consistent and reasonably priced. And if you're going to a local pub on a weeknight for a late dinner, that's what you're looking for.

d58oUx-v9kqCd8nZPFRw_Q.text: Great environment and decor. Great beers. Very mediocre food served by poorly trained staff who do not speak english. Friendly and helpful manager don't make up for the staff or the food.

BAXj2qAtzQ2BY0vwPsiNEA.text: Shepherds Market area is a good place to drink in the summer evenings. Tucked away, out of site of the hordes on Piccadilly, a nice square type location and the Kings Arms isa good pub.

4qr8OCSQc7eHj3IxX5Ws_w.text: Away from the crowds and not to expensive. Good little pub with decent food. Get away from the hords and have a quiet pint here :)

VsZVeHiHP6Y_N59u8GWpmg.text: The Kings Arms was my favorite pub that I visited on my stay in London.  The staff was very friendly, the food was great, and well priced.  Its located in the heart of the Mayfair district and I highly recommend it.

xDLrNADoxkEe_GN3XpC9zA.text: Traditional pub with friendly service and great fish and chips.  It was hard to find a traditional pub in this area and this one is a great find.If things are crowded head upstairs but order your drink and food at the main bar.  You carry up your beer, and they'll bring up your food based on your table number which is on your table, so have it handy when you order.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom

MZi6eKxW1JxvJh8D_hO9Qw.text: Nothing exceptionable but a decent pub in general.  Can't go wrong with some fish & chips with mushy peas and a couple of pints of Seafarer's. The curry sauce that comes with the "big" fish & chips goes great with chips but I don't think it's worth the extra 2 quid.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. The big fish & chips.  Nice curry sauce.
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips with mushy peas

-yM0FG-rIEH_q1X3GQhzcA.text: I came in here because the décor looked warm and inviting and classic.  And also because the variety of beers is much higher than average.  I think the English are starting to experiment more and that is exciting.  I had a pint of the Greene King ale from cask and it was lovely.Service is the usual, you walk up to the bar and pay for your pint then take it to your seat.

4SPDNUT39oAYJn337jxyGQ.text: Food was very poor and waitstaff had no idea what they had stocked behind the bar. They knew only about the typical beers and none of the others on the changing tap. They had about 8 whiskies, of which the bartender only knew name of 2. Bar and tables were sticky and no beer selections that matched an American's palate. Bangers and mash were hard and came with way too much gravy. It was served in a bowl so the gravy made it almost a soup. The baked potato was too buttery and outside not cooked warm enough. Prices are reasonable and a few TVs but other than that this place is to avoid. No air conditioning and dirty bathrooms. Not my type of bar at all.

EE2w1vCYHEg7l9HZPsuKGg.text: A nice local pub in Shepherds Market. Very busy, nice people, traditional pub food plus everything from burgers to burritos. I certainly didn't come from LA to eat burgers or burritos in a local pub. The lager was cold and tasty and the berry cider was a unique twist and very good. We had fish and chips and they were pretty average (which may be a function of fish and chips, so....) and steak and ale pie. The pie was about what I'd expected, very hard, tasteless crust around a bit of beef stew- again, nothing special (again, that might just be what a steak and ale pie is). Every other meat pie I've had has been very bland and tasteless, too.If you want to eat at a traditional British pub, I'm pretty sure you won't find any that distinguishes themselves from the others as far as the pub comfort food goes. At $40GBP for two meals and a beer and a cider, it's about what should be expected in central London.Shepherds Market is a fun little pocket in Mayfair that begs more exploration.

dzqQfam7uL7gBIvpZU0LFA.text: This is a fairly average pub in an area just a bit off of Piccadilly. The usual range of beers. The usual difficulty in getting a beer when the place is busy. If you a in the neighborhood, it's a nice place to grab a pint. However, there isn't much to distinguish it from many others.

scnRWuhyms5qM61L-Tfzkg.text: Great Fish & Chips! Great atmosphere and off the beaten path. Thanks to the concierge at the Hilton that this American found it. Yay!

IS4Jzn8xGzeQHty6vNzdBw.text: Just off Piccadilly Road near the Sheraton, this pub is tucked down the street. We arrived after a long flight and checked in plus there was a football game going on. We left a returned about 20 mins to get a table for my family. Order at the bar for your drinks. Menu varied. Enjoyed the chicken mushroom pie, fish and chips and jacket potato. In the US we call that baked potato. Friendly service. Freshly prepared food. Average prices for the Mayfair area. Would return. Place emptied out once football over. And by football I mean soccer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Menu peek
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Plank of fish and chips w garden peas
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Chicken mushroom pie

fTgWdPY7DQOAynKzrn37rA.text: I can't quite remember how many pubs there actually were in this part of Mayfair (or even in Mayfair as a whole, not that I actually went looking for them). Anyway, since I could only pick one of them I decided that I would pick this one and, well, it was okay but I can't say that it was hugely inspiring. Like many of the London pubs it doesn't have a beer garden (or a rooftop deck) so you basically have to walk past all the smokers congregating at the front door. Also the ground floor bar was pretty crowded when I was here, but fortunately they do have a second floor, and for some reason, when I went up there, it was basically empty, even though the bar was staffed. Okay, there was a good range of beers on tap, including some craft beers (or ales to be more precise) however it wasn't anything that I could say was hugely fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom

QW_2hqhQLXsLfrGhJofV3A.text: We stopped here on our last night in London. It was a Friday and it was super packed. The "veggie fish" and chips, which is really fried halloumi cheese was amazing, but who doesn't love fried cheese?  The curry sauce with the chips was also super tasty.  The fish was nicely done, but huge.  We couldn't finish is and were disappointing that they didn't have togo boxes. They also had some interesting ciders, I tried a passion fruit one that was super tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian Fried Halloumi Cheese & Chips
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fish & Chips with Curry Sauce
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Tasty Cider

NG5W5bApRioZXAsfTpiLSQ.text: Great ambiance, large portions and great value for the food. Ordered the chicken and fiancé got the fish and chips. For the price, I felt the food and portion sizes were a steal!

xSMgw-IG7s9Colz2aM55MQ.text: We had a brilliant Sunday evening meal at the Kings Arms.  My wife and daughter had the Cod and chips which came out fresh, hot and very tasty.  I had the steak & ale pie which was excellent.Our server was very pleasant and her service was just right in terms of attention.Highly recommended gem tucked away in the quaint Shepard Market area just off Piccadilly.

tJUyX9LcRbnMF3nOtiKdag.text: I'm a fan of this cute lil pub, with a lovely upstairs.You order your food at the counter - I got Anna's Happy Sausages, and they were DELICIOUS.I do not eat potatoes, so they kindly substituted with another sausage.The staff was VERY friendly, and checked in with us.

hwD2CESK7RxXBfhSbScw3A.text: This is a really great pub with a really great staff! The staff loves Breaking Bad, so when I sat down and saw a quote from the show on a chalkboard next to my table, I laughed out loud! I wanted to get away from the stress that show had caused me but it looked like I was in great company. Super friendly staff and excellent chicken sandwiches and fish and chips, A++++++

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom

Gziu4P77pwow9YiNjoh3Aw.text: Nice pub, tucked away from the main tourist drag ssshhhh...craft beers are nice but what happened to the price of beer? Ouch!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Tapas menu

z_pNommgXqoKBpO6uO6dyg.text: This place was recommended by a bartender at the hotel we were staying at as being the best place to get Fish & Chips.  As any tourists wanting to try to the local specialties, we embarked on a journey to Kings Arms.  There was a football match going on when we had visited because the pub was packed on the first floor so we made our way upstairs where it was much quieter.  There were TVs upstairs with the game on but the crowd was subdued. Service is non-existent which means you go to the bartender, place your order and they bring your food to you, no follow up if you need anything else.  This requires some adjusting and learning local customs especially coming from the US where we take customer service seriously.So we ordered a plate of Fish & Chips and a local ale to try.  The fish was tasty, nothing spectacular and the chips were average.  The food wasn't mind blowing, didn't tantalize the taste buds.....just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fish N Chips
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fish N Chips

fdzEJd7LznRjJX8GkHIo-g.text: Really good pub food, cask pull beers(ok a fake IPA @ 3.4%), but the other brews are plenty good and Shepards market is a great little area.  Nice popular after work spot and small restaurant pub upstairs.  Classic pub English style

SbdWpLjboCECBX0fonyGTA.text: Great pub!  Highly recommend for a pint and dinner. The chicken and mushroom pie is fantastic.

bzMNoFVDDHQucUoN3P1thw.text: Cosy corner pub located in Shepherds Market and around the corner from Green Park. Stopped in here for a pint while waiting for a table at Burger & Lobster. Nice range of beers on tap and a tasty menu. Mixed pleasant crowd of locals, builders and tourists. Lots of men here by themselves watching football on the tvs. I will definitely pop in here again if I'm in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom

9RPN7bUKo-508m8WbTIMTA.text: Very comfortable little pub. Nice mix of people, always good to see. Kids party upstairs, business types, painters and decorators downstairs. I like the exposed beams and the general vibe. Footy on the t.v but quite quiet and not over bearing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Peroni
Photo of The Kings Arms - London, United Kingdom. Cosy little pub
